content.body:
This article explains how to add photos to your entities. For more information on the size recommendations for photos, see [Photo Guidelines](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/360021516251\-Photo\-Guidelines).





To add a photo:





1. Click **Knowledge Graph** in the navigation bar and click **Entities**.
2. Click on the entity you would like to edit.
3. Click **Media** in the left sidebar.
4. Click on the pencil icon (![mceclip0.png](https://help.yext.com/hc/article_attachments/360034550952/mceclip0.png)) next to the **Business Logo** or **Photo Gallery** field and make your desired change.




   * Note: If you already have a Business Logo added, you will need to delete the existing image before you can add a new one.





*
  * Add a photo:



    * When adding new photos, you can upload a new image or select one from your asset library. Follow the steps below accordingly:




      1. If you are adding your first photo a dialog box will appear. Otherwise, click on the **Select Photos** link to add additional photos.
      2. You can drag and drop photos directly into the box, click **Upload Photos** and select photos from your computer, click **Enter URLs** to enter a list of URLs, or click **Select Assets** to add photo assets.
      3. To make any adjustments to the image, hover over a photo and click **Edit**. From here you can rotate, crop, or apply an aspect ratio to the photo. Once you have made your desired adjustments, click **Done**.
      4. Click **Continue**.
      5. (Optional) Add your desired description, caption, alternate text, or click\-through URL in the text box.




         * **Description**: Used to place a title or a brief description of the media selected.



           * Note: Although there is no character limit in this field, publishers typically accept photo descriptions that are 100 characters or less.




         * **Details**: Used to provide more information of the media selected.
         * **Alternate Text**: Used to describe an image. Alternate text is read by screen readers for those who are visually impaired and can display in place of an image if it fails to load.
         * **Click\-through Url**: Used to link a customer to a website through an image when the image is clicked.




  * Rotate or crop a photo:



    1. Hover over the desired photo and click **Edit**.
    2. Rotate or crop the photo and click **Done**.




  * Delete a photo:



    1. Click on the trash can icon (![mceclip1.png](https://help.yext.com/hc/article_attachments/360034561691/mceclip1.png)) to the right of the desired photo.




  * Arrange the order of photos:




    1. Drag and drop the photo you'd like to move by clicking on the three lines (![mceclip2.png](https://help.yext.com/hc/article_attachments/360034562091/mceclip2.png)) to the left of the desired photo.




       * Note: Not all publishers respect photo order.





5. To add additional photos, click **Select Photos**.



   * Note: Additional photos can only be added to the Photo Gallery. The Business Logo field only accepts one photo.




6. Click **Save**.





![Add_or_update_photos_GIF_2021_v2.gif](https://help.yext.com/hc/article_attachments/360091333071/Add_or_update_photos_GIF_2021_v2.gif)

helpstarter_helpArticleBodyMarkdown.markdown:
This article explains how to add photos to your entities. For more information on the size recommendations for photos, see Photo Guidelines.

To add a photo:

  1. Click Knowledge Graph in the navigation bar and click Entities.
  2. Click on the entity you would like to edit.
  3. Click Media in the left sidebar.
  4. Click on the pencil icon () next to the Business Logo or Photo Gallery field and make your desired change.
    • Note: If you already have a Business Logo added, you will need to delete the existing image before you can add a new one.
    • Add a photo:
      • When adding new photos, you can upload a new image or select one from your asset library. Follow the steps below accordingly:
        1. If you are adding your first photo a dialog box will appear. Otherwise, click on the Select Photos link to add additional photos.
        2. You can drag and drop photos directly into the box, click Upload Photos and select photos from your computer, click Enter URLs to enter a list of URLs, or click Select Assets to add photo assets.
        3. To make any adjustments to the image, hover over a photo and click Edit. From here you can rotate, crop, or apply an aspect ratio to the photo. Once you have made your desired adjustments, click Done.
        4. Click Continue.
        5. (Optional) Add your desired description, caption, alternate text, or click-through URL in the text box.
          • Description: Used to place a title or a brief description of the media selected.
            • Note: Although there is no character limit in this field, publishers typically accept photo descriptions that are 100 characters or less.
          • Details: Used to provide more information of the media selected.
          • Alternate Text: Used to describe an image. Alternate text is read by screen readers for those who are visually impaired and can display in place of an image if it fails to load.
          • Click-through Url: Used to link a customer to a website through an image when the image is clicked.
    • Rotate or crop a photo:
      1. Hover over the desired photo and click Edit. 
      2. Rotate or crop the photo and click Done.
    • Delete a photo:
      1. Click on the trash can icon () to the right of the desired photo.
    • Arrange the order of photos:
      1. Drag and drop the photo you'd like to move by clicking on the three lines () to the left of the desired photo.
        • Note: Not all publishers respect photo order. 
  1. To add additional photos, click Select Photos.
    • Note: Additional photos can only be added to the Photo Gallery. The Business Logo field only accepts one photo.
  2. Click Save.

content.name: Add or Update Photos
